intro: Merckia peploides, commonly known as the woolly merckia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Merckia peploides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
